data.randomm.rand_chr(min_c: str, max_c: str) → str[source]

Returns a char in the range [min_chr, max_chr] Parameters:

min_c (str): The left end of the range max_c (str): The right end of the range

Returns:

str: A char in the range [min_c, max_c]

data.randomm.rand_chr_until(min_c: str, max_c: str, condition_fn: Callable[[str], bool]) → str[source]

Returns a char in teh range [min_chr, max_chr] until it mets the condition Parameters:

min_c (str): The left end of the range max_c (str): The right end of the range condition_fn (Callable[[str],bool]): The condition function

Returns:

str: A char in the range [min_c, max_c] that satisfies the condition

data.validation module

data.validation.does_char_fall_within_range(char: str, min_char: str, max_char: str) → bool[source]
data.validation.does_number_match_regex(n: int, data_type: Type[int | float], regex: str | None = None) → int | float[source]

Checks if n matches a specified regular expression pattern based on its data type.

Parameters:

n (int | float): The number to be checked. data_type (Type[int | float]): The type of the number (int or float). regex (str, optional): Regular expression pattern to match against.

If not provided, a default pattern based on the data type will be used.

Returns:

int | float: True if number matches the specified regular expression pattern, otherwise False.

Raises:

TypeError: If data_type is not int or float.

data.validation.does_string_match_regex(text: str, pattern: str = '^[A-Z][a-z]+$') → bool[source]

Checks if a string matches a specified regular expression pattern.

Parameters:

text (str): The string to be checked. pattern (str, optional): Regular expression pattern to match against.

The default pattern checks if the string follows a specific naming convention where the first letter is capitalized and the rest are lowercase.

Returns:

bool: True if the string matches the specified regular expression pattern, otherwise False.

data.validation.is_credit_card_valid(card_number: str) → bool[source]

Check if a credit card number is valid according to the Luhn algorithm.

Args: - card_number (str): The credit card number to be validated.

Returns: - bool: True if the credit card number is valid, False otherwise.
